post.summary: Add a new subscription for live alarm notification
post.description:
We propose an event driven mechanism to access the data changes. Instead of continuously reading a data you may subscribe to a value change.
That resource path is used to subscribe to an alarms of openBOS when it is triggered.
As soon as client has subscribed he will be able to receive the state change of alarms inside openBOS.

requestBody.description: DTO that contains alarmInstance Id, alarmTrigger Id and Comment

post.summary: Authenticate a user of the openBOS using the local edge access point (does not apply for cloud authentication)
post.description:
openBOS offers a secure authentication using Json Web Token (JWT) workflow.
This resource path authenticates an API user and retrieves a valid token to be set inside Authorization header for further API calls
Header format as follows Authorization: Bearer "jwt"
Token duration is 30 minutes

200.description: Authentication result including the JWT to be used for further calls

patch.summary: Configure the initial password on the edge
patch.description: Changes the password of the first default user. Used only once at site's initialization.

200.description: Indicates the initial password has been correctly set

post.summary: Refresh the access token (Json Web Token) for further API calls
post.description:
Used to generate a new JWT (Json Web Token) on basis of the one retrieved by /api/v1/ontology/authentication.
It allows to refresh communication token without having to pass original login/password

200.description: Authentication result including the JWT to be used for further calls

get.summary: Returns users of a certain type for a certain property zone
get.description:
This resource path retrieves the basics information of users matching a criteria.
openBOS offers several type of users and you may have differences in roles, agreements, â€¦ between these types of users.
We are managing: Tenant, Owner, PropertyManager, FacilityManager, Visitor and Administrator. Connected user must have at least CanConfigureUser access right to retrieve more users than himself.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of requested users

parameters.name: zoneId
parameters.description: Id of the parent property zone

200.description: List of basics information of users matching the criteria.

get.summary: Get detail of a specific user
get.description:
This resource path retrieves detailed information of a user identified by its unique identifier
openBOS offers several type of users having different roles, agreements, â€¦ between these types of users. Connected user must have at least CanConfigureUser access right and same root role as the requested user to use this method on a user different than himself.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the user

200.description: Retrieve detailed information of found users.

get.summary: Get lockout duration for a given locked out user
get.description: If too many consecutive login failures the end-user is lockout a certain ammount of time. This resource path retrieves the time to wait before being authorized to make a new attempt.

parameters.name: login
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the user

200.description: The duration in ms that needs to wait the user to log in again

get.summary: Get the roles available in the site
get.description: This resource path retrieves the list of roles a user can be assigned to. openBOS uses a Role Based Access Control system. Each user can be assigned to one or several Role. Each role being configured with access rights and topology accessibility (limit to certain zones)

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description:
Contains search pattern to produce the list. If no set all roles will be returned. Filter can look like :
    Name contains "A"
    Name = "A"
    Name startswith "A"
    Name endswith "A"
    Tags contains "A"

And/Or can be used to generate complex query like : (Tags contains "A")or(Name endswith "r")

200.description: List of roles matching the filter criteria.

get.summary: Get a specific role
get.description: This resource path retrieves a specific role by its unique identifier. openBOS uses a Role Based Access Control system. Each user can be assigned to one or several Role. Each role being configured with access rights and topology accessibility (limit to certain zones)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id of the requested role

get.summary: Get the list of stations inside the site
get.description:
This resource path retrieves the basics information of station defined in the site.
A station is an hardware embedding at least a middleware. That middleware may read several protocols and several networks.
Detailled information on a station can be found by using station resource path including its unique id (ie: .../station/{id} )

200.description: Retrieve the list of station in the system with for each the basics information

get.summary: Get detailled information for a specific station
get.description:
A station is an hardware embedding at least a middleware. That middleware may read several protocols and several networks.
That resource path returns the detailled information of a specific station in the site.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the station

get.summary: Get the status of synchronization of the stations inside the site
get.description:
A station is an hardware embedding at least a middleware. That middleware may read several protocols and several networks.
The synchronization is the operation of keeping in sync the openBOS and its underlying middleware.
Each time an update is done on openBOS that has impact on the middleware layer (used to communicate with fieldbus devices) a synchronization is required to align both definition.
Synchronization can be set manual or automatic for each station.
That route retrieves the synchronization status for all the stations of the site.

200.description: Retrieves synchronization status of middleware stations

get.summary: Get the database of devices and parameters of a network
get.description:
A station is a hardware embedding at least one middleware.
That middleware may read several protocols.
Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): the networks.
Each network includes a collection of devices, infrastructure, has a list of parameters, a list of datapoints, [...]: we call it the network organization.
The network organization is built has a standard hierarchic tree.
The exploration of an organization is done level by level by requesting the children.
This resource path retrieves a level in the hierarchic tree of the network organization

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the network

parameters.name: parentId
parameters.description: null to get the root branches, otherwise parent id of the branch to get its children

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Optional filter on datapoints

200.description: Retrieves the branches matching parentId criteria

get.summary: Get the version number of the database of devices and parameters of a network
get.description:
A station is a hardware embedding at least one middleware.That middleware may read several protocols.
Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): the networks.
Each network includes a collection of devices, infrastructure, has a list of parameters, a list of datapoints, [...]: we call it the network organization.
This resource path retrieves the internal version of the network organization in the database (each update of the network organization increase this version number)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the network

get.summary: Get an item (branch) of the database of devices and parameters (temporary or not) of a network
get.description:
A station is a hardware embedding at least one middleware.That middleware may read several protocols.
Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): the networks.
Each network includes a collection of devices, infrastructure, has a list of parameters, a list of datapoints, [...]: we call it the "network organization".
The network organization is built has a standard hierarchic tree.
Querying the organization is done level by level.
When updating a network organization a temporary one is created and manipulated. Once the temporary organization is comitted it will become the newest.
This resource path retrieves an item (branch) in the hierarchic tree of the network organization (temporary or not)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the branch

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Optional filter on datapoints

200.description: Retrieves the branch matching id criteria

get.summary: Get the root level of the database of devices and parameters of a network
get.description:
A station is a hardware embedding at least one middleware.That middleware may read several protocols.
Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): the networks.
Each network includes a collection of devices, infrastructure, has a list of parameters, a list of datapoints, [...]: we call it the "network organization".
The network organization is built has a standard hierarchic tree.
Querying the organization is done level by level.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the network

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Optional filter on datapoints

200.description: Retrieves the root branch matching the network id

Get the list of available protocol driver in a specific Station
get.description:
A station is a hardware embeding at least a middleware.
That middleware may read several protocols.
Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): The networks.
That resource path sends back the entire protocols supported by the Station . That may be used to read data from fieldbus.
For more information on a driver use the resource path .../station/{stationId}/driver/get/{id} with the ID of the driver.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the station

200.description: List of protocol driver definitions on the station.

get.summary: Get the detail of a specific protocol driver on a station
get.description:
A station is a hardware embeding at least a middleware.
That middleware may read several protocols. Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): the networks.
Each fieldbus is accessible through a dedicated driver, this command retrieve the detail of a driver.
The driver detail contains the list of configuration values used to communicate with the fieldbus device of the protocol.
The list of configuration is dependant from the driver itself (ie: the configuration used for a ModBus communication is different from the configuration used for a BACNet communication.

parameters.name: stationId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the station

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the driver

200.description: Protocol driver definitions on the station.

get.summary: Get the list of field bus networks available in the whole site.
get.description:
A station is a hardware embedding at least a middleware.
That middleware may read several protocols.
Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): the networks.
A fieldbus network is a declared network of devices communicating on a protocol.
We may have for example LonWorks, BACnet, KNX, MQTT network That resource path returns the collection of available networks in a station.
For detailled on a network use the dedicated network resource path with the ID of the network (.../network/{id})

200.description: List of basics definition of network inside the site.

get.summary: Get detail information of a specific network of a station.
get.description:
A station is a hardware embeding at least a middleware.
That middleware may read several protocols.
Each protocol has a unique driver (i.e KNX) and may have several fieldbus networks of that protocol (several networks and database of the same protocol): the networks.
That resource path gives the details of the specific network giving its unique identifier as parameter.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the network

200.description: Detail information of a specific network.

get.summary: Get the list of alarm templates in the site
get.description:
An alarm template is used to create several alarm instances that will have the same behaviour on a set of DataPointInstance
The alarm template describes the alarm triggers, and the selection of DataPoint on which the alarm template will applied
The selection of datapointinstance can be a manual selection of individual datapointinstance or all datapoint instances matching a datapoint template inside a zone or functional block
This resource path returns the list of alarm templates that are configured within the site

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the first returned alarm template (for paging)

get.summary: Get the list of asset's template in the site
get.description:
openBOS manages assets in the building (lamp, button, fancoil, ...).
Every asset refer to a template and are all instances of an asset template. (i.e. Each lamp is an instance of a lamp template.)
That resource path returns the complete list of asset template in the building.
From here you retrieve only the basic information of each template.
To collect the detailed information on a specific asset template you will need to use the dedicated endpoint by using the unique identifier of the entity (/api/v1/ontology/{entity}/{id}).

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Contains search pattern to produce the list

numberOfFunctionalBlockTemplates.description:
Number of functional block templates to create
Name of each functional block template will be FBT#x with x from 1 to n
Each functional block template has a tag bos:function:fb#x with x from 1 to n

numberOfPropertiesPerFBT.description:
Number of properties in each functional block template
Name of each property will be Property#x with x from 1 to n
Each property has a tag bos:function:property#x with x from 1 to n

numberOfDatapointsPerFB.description:
Number of datapoints in each functional block template
Name of each datapoint will be Datapoint#x with x from 1 to n
Each datapoint has a tag bos:function:datapoint#x with x from 1 to n

numberOfFunctionalBlockInstancesPerTempl.description:
Number of functional block instance for each functional block template
Name of each functional block instance will be FBT#x_FBI#y with FBT#x being name of template and y from 1 to n
Each functional block instance has a tag bos:function:fb#x with x from 1 to n

numberOfTypesOfRoom.description:
Number of type of room (zone template)
Each room zone template will be named TRoom#x with x from 1 to n
Each room template will have the tag bos:space:room:office Each room template will have the tag myroom#x with x based on the number of its template

numberOfPropertiesPerRoom.description:
Number of properties in each room zone template (note that building and floor has NO properties)
Name of each property will be Property#x with x from 1 to n
Each property has a tag bos:function:property#x with x from 1 to n

numberOfDatapointsPerRoom.description:
Number of datapoints in each room zone template (note that building and floor has NO datapoints)
Name of each datapoint will be Datapoint#x with x from 1 to n
Each datapoint has a tag bos:function:datapoint#x with x from 1 to n

numberOfRoomsPerTypeAndPerFloor.description:
Number of room (zone instance) per floor and per room type
Each room zone instance will be named TRoom#x_Room#y with TRoom#x name of template and x from 1 to n
Each room zone instance will have the tag bos:space:room:office

numberOfFunctionalBlockInstancePerRoom.description:
Number of functional block instance that are put inside each room
If there is not enough functional block instance (compare to number of rooms) then some functional block instance will belong to several room

useMemoryDPOnRooms.description: If true datapoints of room will have a random memory datapoint address with a scene that cause the datapoint to change continously

useMemoryDPOnFbs.description: If true datapoints of functional blocks will have a random memory datapoint address

memoryDPFormat.description:
Format of the memory datapoint scene.
If empty the scene will be : /scene=ana:x:y:z to build a DP with continuous changing value
Format is : /scene=ana:{periodMs}:{minValue}:{maxValue}

synchronousGeneration.description: If true generation of database will be synchronous (rest call will be blocked during execution)

numberOfBuildings.description:
Number of buildings (zone instance)
Zone template of all buildings will be named TBuilding
Zone template of the building has a tag bos:building
Each building zone instance will be named Building#x with x from 1 to n
Zone intance of the building has a tag bos:building

numberOfFloorsPerBuilding.description:
Number of floors per building
Zone template of all floors will be named TFloor
Zone template of the floor has a tag bos:structure:floor
Each floor zone instance will be named Floor#x with x from 1 to n
Zone intance of the floor has a tag bos:structure:floor

generateMapviewForEachFloor.description: Indicates if we generate a mapview for each floor

mapviewFunctionalBlockWidthAndHeight.description: Width and height of each functional block on mapview (between 0 and 1)

mapviewFunctionalBlockSpace.description: X and Y space between functional blocks on mapview (between 0 and 1)

mapviewZoneWidthAndHeight.description: Width and height of each zone polygon on mapview between 0 and 1

mapviewZoneSpace.description: X and Y space between zones on mapview (between 0 and 1)

createUserAccessingAll.description:
Create the user that can access all.
Name of user is : UserALL
Paswword of user is : UserALL(1)

createUserAccessingFloor.description:
Create the user that can access a floor and all its rooms
Name of user is : User_NameOfFloor with NameOfFloor name of the floor
Paswword of user is : Pass_NameOfFloor(1) with NameOfFloor name of the floor

createUserAccessingRoom.description:
Create the user that can access only one room
Name of user is : User_NameOfRoom with NameOfRoom name of the room
Paswword of user is : Pass_NameOfRoom(1) with NameOfRoom name of the room
